column4: guyz aparently this says it failed to initialise the nvidia kernel module coz its version is 1.09755 but the X module is only version 1.09631, what should i do install a newer X module? or an earlyer nvidia kernel... ?
you likely has both nvidia-glx and nvidia-glx-ne instaled or you have one of those and used envy or installled another driver manually
stick with *only* one of the drivers
good adivce, but i'm really new with linux and i have no clue how to check wether thats that case or how to fix it if that;s so
any tips?
do you used envy or automatix?

neither the first time i notivced a graphics driver beeing installed was when i activedted (or tried to) the special desktop effects ubuntu auto downloaded a driver and installed it ... then it restarted and it died so i had to (with some help from here) use the nano edditor to eddit Xorg.conf
this time i used the synaptics package manager to install the "nvidia_glx_new" and it said it was gonna unistall the old driver and install the new one and then i got stuck in this message i'm in now
use synaptic to search nvidia-glx and make sure only one of the two nvidia-glx or nvidia-glx-new is instaled (keep the -new)
somehow some files where not properly uninstaled
use synaptic and purge the two packages and then install one of the two
kk trying to do that now, seems i have to use the nano edditor yet again to change the "driver" back to "nv" since i cant even get into the main destop now
you can do what i said from command line too
sudo apt-get remove --purge nvidia-glx nvidia-glx-new and then after that sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new
seems its all i got access to, however i have no clue how to, i've only been using ubuntu and linux in general for 2 days...
ok scratch that .. ty
if you boot in recovery mode you end up in a console... but you can edit xorg.conf if you prefer
i'm gonna try the command line way i can handle command lines =p
done but all it said was setting up nvidia-glx-new (bunch of version numbers) and then the prompt came back no comfirmation on wether or not was done successfuly.... is this normal?
yes, it is normal
ok it seemed to work fine and then as i just wrote i tryed enabling the desktop effects thing and it auto uninstalled the glx-new and installed the glx which damanged things again
